hints.title: Voronoi Geometry Encodes Metric
hints.content:
135: :label: prop-voronoi-encodes-metric
136: 
137: Let $\rho(x)$ be a smooth, positive density on a domain $\mathcal{X} \subset \mathbb{R}^d$. Sample $N$ points $\{x_1, \ldots, x_N\}$ from $\rho$ and construct the Voronoi tessellation $\{\mathcal{V}_i\}$.
138: 
139: In the limit $N \to \infty$, the **local geometry** of the Voronoi tessellation (cell shapes, plaquette angles) converges to a Riemannian metric:
140: 
141: $$
142: g_{ij}(x) = c \cdot \left[\frac{\partial^2}{\partial x^i \partial x^j} \log \rho(x)\right] + \text{const} \cdot \delta_{ij}
143: $$
144: 
145: up to conformal factors.
146: 
147: **Heuristic Argument**:
148: 
149: Consider the **centroidal Voronoi tessellation** (CVT), where cell centroids coincide with generator points. The optimization functional for CVT is:
150: 
151: $$
152: F[\{x_i\}, \{\mathcal{V}_i\}] = \sum_{i=1}^N \int_{\mathcal{V}_i} \|y - x_i\|^2 \rho(y) dy
153: $$
154: 
155: At the optimum, the Voronoi cells have shapes determined by the **second derivatives** of $\rho$:
156: 
157: - In regions where $\rho$ is flat, cells are roughly spherical
158: - In regions where $\rho$ has high curvature (large $|\nabla^2 \log \rho|$), cells are elongated along eigenvectors of the Hessian
159: 
160: This geometric distortion is precisely what defines a Riemannian metric:
161: 
162: $$
163: g_{ij} \propto \left(\nabla^2 \log \rho\right)_{ij}
164: $$
165: 
166: **Status**: This is a **heuristic argument**, not a full proof. A rigorous result requires:
167: 
168: 1. Proving the CVT convergence theorem for densities $\rho(x)$
169: 2. Showing the limit geometry is Riemannian
170: 3. Relating the limiting metric to $\rho$ via the Monge-Amp\u00e8re equation
171:
